definition: quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals
12th earthly branch: 9-11 p.m., 10th solar month (7th November-6th December), year of the Boar/ancient Chinese compass point: 330°
"knife" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 18)/see also 立刀旁[li4 dao1 pang2]/see also 側刀旁|侧刀旁[ce4 dao1 pang2]
lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom)/fig. etched in one's memory/unforgettable
to brook no delay/to demand immediate action

sentences.english: Her initials were enchased on the monument.
sentences.chinese: 她的名字縮寫字母刻在紀念碑上。

sentences.english: To engrave your name on an amaranthine life tree …
sentences.chinese: 刻你的名字在不凋的生命樹上。

sentences.english: Beat base on quarter have lucky pattern, among them what the front engraves is animal of lion body luck.
sentences.chinese: 鼓座基上刻有吉祥圖案，其中正面刻的是獅形瑞獸。

sentences.english: His initials were engraved on the cigarette case.
sentences.chinese: 他姓名的首字母刻在香菸盒上。

sentences.english: He drew the design on the stencil with a steel stylus.
sentences.chinese: 他用鐵筆把設計圖刻在蠟紙上。

sentences.english: Laughter also reverberating in the ear, sigher engraved in the hearts.
sentences.chinese: 笑聲還回蕩在耳旁，情分依然刻在心上。

sentences.english: He carved his initials on the inside of a ring.
sentences.chinese: 他把他的姓名縮寫刻在一枚戒指的內側。

sentences.english: Could you find love in me, would you carve me in the tree.
sentences.chinese: 你是否感受到了這愛，把我的名字刻進樹裏。

sentences.english: Keto's body slowly becomes bloated. Her limbs however stay emaciated.
sentences.chinese: 刻託的身體慢慢變得臃腫，可四肢依舊枯瘦。

sentences.english: He cut his name into the bark with his knife.
sentences.chinese: 他用小刀把自己的名字刻在樹皮上。

sentences.english: The design of a new kind of UV or DUV lithography lenses is described in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 設計了一種新的紫外或深紫外光刻物鏡。

sentences.english: God said that the cause afterlife Sansheng carved in stone on top.
sentences.chinese: 神說來世的因緣刻在三生石之上。

sentences.english: The owner's name marked on this cigarette lighter has been filed away by the thief.
sentences.chinese: 主人刻在打火機上的姓名被小偷用銼刀銼掉了。

sentences.english: He writes His revelation in the universe which He created and He also carves His revelation in our heart.
sentences.chinese: 把的啓示寫在所手造的萬有中，也刻在我們心版上。

sentences.english: It was such a precious moment I didn't want to move.
sentences.chinese: 刻如此寶貴以至於我不想挪動半步。

sentences.english: Write injuries in sand, kindnesses in marble.
sentences.chinese: 仁慈刻在大理石上，侮辱寫在沙子裏。

definition: an instant (Sanskrit: ksana)/split second/the twinkling of an eye
surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image
to engrave a seal/stamp mark/to print with carved type/to leave a deep impression
one instant/very short time/the twinkle of an eye
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
fan/sliding, hinged or detachable flat part of sth/classifier for doors, windows etc
to fan/to slap sb on the face
